item.title: Quickly Finding Large Files
item.description: Quickly Finding Large Files Problem/Need Your disk is running out of space, and you need to quickly identify which files are taking up the most room on your Linux system. Main Tip/Command Use the find command combined with du and sort to list files by size: find / -type f -size +1G -print0 | xargs -0 du -h | sort -rh Brief Command Explanation find /: Starts searching from the root directory (/).
